playn.core

Interface Events.Input

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Events.Position, Keyboard.Event, Keyboard.TypedEvent, Mouse.ButtonEvent, Mouse.MotionEvent, Mouse.WheelEvent, Pointer.Event, Touch.Event
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Events.Input.Impl, Events.Position.Impl, Keyboard.Event.Impl, Keyboard.TypedEvent.Impl, Mouse.ButtonEvent.Impl, Mouse.MotionEvent.Impl, Mouse.WheelEvent.Impl, Pointer.Event.Impl, Touch.Event.Impl
    Enclosing class:
    Events

    public static interface Events.Input
    The base for all input events.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Events.Input.Impl 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void capture()
      Where appropriate, causes all subsequent events in the current touch, point or mousedown to be sent to the current listener.
      Events.Flags flags()
      The flags that control the processing of this event.
      double time()
      The time at which this event was generated, in milliseconds.

    • Method Detail

      • flags

        Events.Flags flags()
        The flags that control the processing of this event.

      • time

        double time()
        The time at which this event was generated, in milliseconds. This time's magnitude is not portable (i.e. may not be the same across backends), clients must interpret it as only a monotonically increasing value.

      • capture

        void capture()
        Where appropriate, causes all subsequent events in the current touch, point or mousedown to be sent to the current listener. Any other layer listeners that have an outstanding "start" will be cancelled.

        This is only valid during dispatch of Pointer.Listener start and drag events, Mouse.LayerListener down and drag events, and Touch.Listener start and move events. Calls at other times will be ignored.

        The classic use case for this is if some game element is scrollable and yet contains an element that is pressable. After measuring user intent, the scrollable listener can capture the event stream and thereby cancel the pressable's listener.

        NOTE: this is only meaningful if event propagation is enabled for the platform (Platform.setPropagateEvents(boolean)). If event propagation is not enabled, there will only ever be a single layer listener involved in an interaction.
